title: How to spot a witch in medieval times - Quora

response.answer_text: she would be independent and have her own opinion and does follow the whole this man has money and status he must be good BS… many witches denied sex with men in the town, or treated patients with old druidic or other methods of herbs and such when medicine was a mans game and only the man was right women are nothing was the view of most just like today. She could also be a widow who was holding her dead husbands property or business and men of the town didn't like that… basically not holding the male of the species as gods and bowing to their every whim got you labeled a witch. Or you piss off a woman who was completely sold on the lies of the time, or who was scare that she was a lesbian and didn't want to be stoned or what ever… that one gal in Salem told those terrible puritan's that the church and god a separate and they did horrible things to her… the puritan's were exceptionally despicable people.
